section.title: Create variables
section.para: As you know test variables are defined at the beginning of the test case. describes this functionality in detail. Besides that it might be helpful to reset existing variables during the test workflow as well as to define new variables.
You can easily use the action <createVariables> in order to declare new variables or overwrite existing variable values.
section.programlisting:
<testcase name="settingVariablesTest"> <variables> <variable name="myVariable" value="12345"/> <variable name="newValue" value="54321"/> </variables> <actions> <echo> <message>Current variable value: ${myVariable} </message> </echo>
<createVariables> <variable name="myVariable" value="${newValue}"/> <variable name="new" value="'this is a test'"/> </createVariables>
<echo> <message>Current variable value: ${myVariable} </message> </echo>
<echo> <message>New variable 'new' has the value: ${new} </message> </echo> </actions> </testcase>
section.para: The test example shows that existing variables are overwritten while new variables are created by simply declaring a new variable name that was not present before. The new variables are valid for the rest of the test flow and can be referred to as usual.
